instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> low no video after Gpu replaced
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> after Gpu replacement I got no video, It chime and loads os since backlight turn on.  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> is low 0.6v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3GPU_SS</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3v3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> 0.6v (diode mode 0.500v)

already replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7870</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U9270</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7812</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7810</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7872</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> low no video after Gpu replaced
threads.message: Bad GPU, no surprise there. These aren't available in new/good order.
